On 9/1/05, maitrikaruna <kevin@...> wrote:

> I am moving tow=
ards something much more complex.  I would like to
> try and implement NEAT=
+Hawkins(On Intelligence) ideas on how the
> brain works.  This requires mo=
re complex structures that allow, for
> instance, for recurrent connections=
 back to *input* nodes.  

Yes, outputs are inputs.  It's all a big loop.  =
But it's more than
just that...  When the 'expected' input (which is an out=
put of an
'expectation' circuit) doesn't match the input, you get one resul=
t. 
When it does, you get another.  But that kind of thing is VERY
differen=
t than NEAT.

I also propose that the pathway that is taken for a signal as=
 it
passes through the brain has some kind of mathematical resemblance to
t=
he actual signal, so that there is legitimacy and relevance to the
kinds of=
 interactions that the signals make as they play off of each
other in the b=
rain.  Does that statement make sense?

> there is also a strong temporal a=
spect to this according to
> hawkins.  incorporating both the feedback and =
temporal aspects into
> a net raises the level of complexity quite a bit.  =
Hawkins team has
> implemented a fixed structure hierarchy that is not real=
ly a NN.  It
> uses bayesian probabilities throughout the feedback mechanis=
m.
> Their early tests show some real promise in invariant visual
> recogni=
tion...but I feel their structure is too constrained and
> would like to se=
e if NEAT can be applied with his concepts
> incorporated.  It may not work=
 or may be too complex...I dunno...

I don't think NEAT is what you want.  =
I think you want a dynamic
network that grows during the life of the organi=
sm.  Which means you
need a set of rules governing that growth.  Evolution =
might best be
applied to those rules, rather than to the structure itself.
=

Also, for something like that, you want to use a mechanism like is
used fo=
r cellular automatons for optimizing the firing so you don't
calculate EVER=
Y neuron for EVERY timestep.

> I am running a software company, so I have =
limited time to theorize
> on this, which I would rather be doing!  But I h=
ave to pay the bills
> somehow ;)

No joke.  :(  Oh to be independently wea=
lthy!
